page.title: 17Walk in the High Street
page.content: Approaching Thurleigh from the west, the first good view is from Mill Hill, across the valley lies Bury Farm, the church and Bury Hill beyond. At the bottom of the hill, the road forks at the brook. A right turn is up hill into the High Street. On the left is the Jackal public house and the adjacent thatched cottages and opposite the former Red Lion public house, also thatched. There is a footpath leading to the Church and another to 17th century Bury farmhouse. The street continues with attractive cottages and the Victorian school building and many trees and hedgerows. At the top of the hill is a track to the earthworks at Bury Hill and a view of the undulating countryside. The old village core ends here.
